intro: Meibomia leptopus, commonly known as the slender meibomia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests or undergrowth. Meibomia leptopus is often found in lowland areas and is adapted to thrive in humid, tropical climates.
